data:
<edited_content>
# Tuition Options by Program

## Introduction

Understanding the financial investment in your education is a crucial step in your academic journey with Excel High School. Before choosing a payment option or enrolling, you need a clear picture of what your tuition covers. This guide outlines the costs for different programs, what's included in your tuition, and additional fees you might encounter. This information will help you plan your educational budget and make confident decisions about your academic future.

## Program Tuition Ranges

Excel High School offers several educational programs designed to meet different academic goals. Each program has its own tuition structure:

### Middle School Program
The Middle School program for grades 6-8 typically costs between $1,200 and $1,500 per academic year. This program builds the foundational skills needed for high school success.

### Standard High School Diploma Program (21.5 Credits)
The Standard Diploma program meets graduation requirements with 21.5 credits of coursework. Tuition generally ranges from $1,500 to $2,000. This option provides a solid high school education that meets standard graduation requirements.

### College Preparatory Diploma Program (24 Credits)
The College Prep program offers a more challenging curriculum with 24 credits, specifically designed to prepare you for college. Tuition typically ranges from $1,800 to $2,300, reflecting the additional coursework and college-readiness focus.

### Advanced Placement (AP) Program
For students seeking college-level challenges while still in high school, AP courses cost between $300 and $450 per course. These courses can help you earn college credit through AP exams.

### Adult Diploma Program
Designed for adult learners returning to complete their high school education, this program typically costs between $1,200 and $1,600. It offers flexibility while maintaining academic quality.

### Individual Courses
If you need specific credits rather than a full program, individual courses typically cost between $200 and $300 for standard courses, while specialized or advanced courses may range from $250 to $450.

## What Your Tuition Covers

When you enroll at Excel High School, your tuition includes several important components:

### Core Academic Benefits
- **Six Credits Per Grade Level**: Your annual tuition covers six full credits of coursework per academic year
- **24/7 Learning Management System Access**: Unlimited access to the online learning platform, allowing you to study whenever works best for you
- **Success Coach Support**: Personalized guidance from a dedicated Success Coach who will help you navigate your academic journey

### Additional Included Services
- **Standard Academic Support**: Access to qualified teachers who can answer questions about your coursework
- **Basic Technology Support**: Assistance with technical issues related to the learning platform
- **Standard Grading and Feedback**: Regular assessment of your work with constructive feedback to help you improve

## Additional Costs to Consider

Beyond your base tuition, there are some additional fees that might apply depending on your specific needs:

### Course Extension Fees
If you need more time to complete your coursework beyond the standard enrollment period, extension fees typically range from $50 to $100 per course.

### Optional Document Services
- **Apostille Services**: If you need your diploma or transcripts authenticated for use in another country, this service costs between $75 and $150. (An apostille is an official certification that makes documents valid internationally.)
- **Additional Official Transcripts**: While your initial transcripts are included in your tuition, additional official copies cost between $15 and $25 each.
- **Expedited Processing**: For urgent document needs, expedited services are available for an additional fee.

## Finding Current Pricing Information

Tuition and fees may change periodically. For the most up-to-date information:

1. Visit the Excel High School website at www.excelhighschool.com
2. Click on the "Tuition & Payment Options" section
3. Select your program of interest to view current rates
4. Contact an Enrollment Specialist at 1-800-620-3844 if you have questions

Enrollment Specialists can provide personalized information about current tuition rates, available discounts, and payment plans.

## Summary

Excel High School offers various programs to meet different educational needs, with tuition varying by program type. Your tuition covers six credits per grade level, 24/7 access to the learning platform, and Success Coach support. Remember to consider potential additional costs like course extensions or document services when planning your educational budget. For the most current pricing information, check the website or speak with an Enrollment Specialist who can provide guidance based on your specific educational goals.
</edited_content>

<edit_summary>
- Simplified some language and removed unnecessary pronouns to make the content more direct and accessible for high school students
- Added a brief explanation of what an apostille is, as this term might be unfamiliar to the target audience
- Removed some instances of "our" and "you're" to create a more neutral, informational tone appropriate for asynchronous learning
- Made minor formatting adjustments to improve readability and flow for self-paced learners
- Maintained all the essential information while making the content more straightforward for students aged 14-18
</edit_summary>
